story.headline: Summer Sea Ice Minimums Keep Shrinking
story.summary: Arctic summer sea ice extent has declined steadily, exposing darker ocean water for longer periods each year.
story.climateImpact: Warming temperatures melt sea ice, and the darker ocean absorbs more heat, amplifying global warming.
causeEffect: Rising air and ocean temperatures melt ice
Loss of reflective ice reduces albedo
More solar energy is absorbed by the ocean
story.scaleContext: The Arctic is warming several times faster than the global average, affecting weather patterns worldwide.
story.outlook: Continued warming risks nearly ice-free summers, disrupting ecosystems and coastal communities.
